column4: Hi, Again with that problem, not yet solved, My wireless Lan card can not see the available networks, some outputs are here, http://pastebin.com/MFCFm7L8 , lshw -c network shows Disabled. HELP, Natty
What wifi card is it?
I read and did all this stuff giving in the link, but no success https://help.ubuntu.com/community/WifiDocs/Driver/bcm43xx
Well broadcom doesn't support linux open drivers so you just have to try different drivers
I was using this wireless lan card since 4 months, but yesterday i  created ADSL connection with pppoeconf command, after that i am not able to use my wireless lan card.
You don't need to mess with network-manager. It works fine if your network drivers are working
Is it an HP laptop with a switch by chance?
Does 'sudo iwlist eth1 scan|grep -i ssid' show AP's?
What does 'service network-manager status' show?
What's telling you 'network Dislabled.'?
lshw -c network says that
Does it work if you click on the network icon?
there, Wirless networks. .. and under that, "Device is not managed"
Can you pastebin your /etc/network/interfaces file to pastebin.com?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/726191/
Comment out the last two lines in that file, save it then restart network-manager with 'sudo service network-manager restart'
I did that already. And i can see networks now.
cool.. so does it work now?
Yea. fine.
awesome :-)
people consider me Network Engg.
